wikipedia_page.main: Idwal Jones ( EED-wəl; December 8, 1887 – November 14, 1964) was a Welsh-American novelist and non-fiction writer. Jones focused a lot of his writing on the beauty and population boom in California and the west.

response: *Idwal Jones (1887–1964, E), novelist and non-fiction writer
*Idwal Jones (writer) (1895–1937), Welsh schoolmaster, poet and dramatist

Whistler's Van is a children's novel by Idwal Jones. Set in rural Wales shortly after World War I,The Newbery Companion by John Thomas Gillespie and Corinne J. Naden, Libraries Unlimited, 2001 p. 87 it tells the story of a young farmboy, Gwilyn, who spends one summer traveling with the gypsies.The Newbery & Caldecott Awards: a Guide to the Medal and Honor Books by the Association for Library Service to Children, ALA Editions, 2009, page 74 The novel, illustrated by Zhenya Gay, was first published in 1936 and was a Newbery Honor recipient in 1937.

Jones was born at Rhoslwyn, Lampeter, the son of D. Teifi Jones, a well-known local politician and eisteddfodwr.  Following army service during the First World War, Idwal Jones entered the University College of Wales, Aberystwyth, where he met D. Gwenallt Jones, who would later write his biography.D. Gwenallt Jones, Cofiant Idwal Jones (1958)  After graduating, he became a schoolteacher at Devil's Bridge.
